title: See How Crops Get Picked Super Fast by Machines!

subtasks: Positioning the harvester in the field
Starting the harvester's engine
Monitoring the machine's front unit
Ensuring the rotating metal spindles function properly
Guiding the harvester across the field
Adjusting harvesting parameters
Ensuring minimal damage to the crop during harvesting
Regularly inspecting the harvester for any damages or malfunctions
Replacing worn spindles or other components
Ensuring the machine's safety features are operational
Observing the harvesting process to identify any damaged cabbages
Adjusting the harvester settings if necessary to reduce damage
Cleaning or inspecting the spindles after harvesting a section
